Eve of the year!  now that the sister train</br>Of gaudy Summer with the wanton Hours</br>With lingering step retire</br>Thy modest charms unfold.
Thee, sober Nymph, the pensive Pleasures hail,</br>And Leisure, roving midst thy teeming shores;</br>Thy purpled heaths full glow,</br>And rich nectarean blooms.
Oh calm enchantress!  when day-cares are lost</br>In twilight glooms, let me attentive view</br>The glow-worm's paly lamp,</br>As misty vapours rise.
Or where the staid rook builds his wick'ry nest,</br>From potent instinct, high in wavy elms,</br>That o'er some Gothic hall,</br>Their darkling umbrage spread.
Nor yet ungrateful is thy morn's approach,</br>Though dropping chill she comes in cloudy vest,</br>And slowly spreads around</br>The landscape dark and dim.
Nor less delights, tho' Philomel retire,</br>Thy red-breast, sacred from domestic trust;</br>Whose homelier notes call up</br>In many a rustic ear
The tale of Babes deserted in the Wood,</br>That sinking lifeless in each other's arms,</br>Thy pitying red-breast saw,</br>And them interr'd with leaves.
And tho' for thee bloom not the summer flow'rs,</br>Emblems of Fancy, Pleasure, Love, and Joy;</br>Annuals and evergreens</br>Paint to the moral view
The Virtues; whose unfading hues out-vie</br>Warm Fancy, fairy Pleasure, juv'nile Joy;</br>Nor less lamented falls</br>Than calmest day's decline;
And far more joyous are thy laughing fields,</br>When sure Possession takes the lead of Hope,</br>Than Flora's tinted robe,</br>Than Summer's brightest beam.
Oh Nymph sedate!  still on thy absent hours</br>May Plenty, Industry, and Peace attend;</br>Nor fear the Boreal blast</br>That bellows thro' the void.</br>
